result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan Lee Thompson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson.ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY:  Aaron A. Nelson DF:  Ryan Lee Thompson appeared. Case called at 10:07.  Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to amended Ct 1 to misdemeanor battery 940.19(1) and amended Ct 2 DC 947.07 in 15CF217. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended Ct 1 and amended Ct 2 in 15CF217. Sentencing arguments. DE has paid $1605.00 in restitution. Court orders DE to submit a letter of apology to the officers involved due to the Court within the next two weeks. 

Ct. 1
- Costs  only of $243.00

Ct. 2
- Costs only of $243.00

To be paid within 60 days.
Harry Whaley ck# 025528 sent this date. eif

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY: Aaron A. Nelson DF: Ryan Lee Thompson appeared. Case called at 2:17. Scheduled for a plea and sentencing. Court authorizes the Clerk to forward the restitution to the victim once both checks have been filed with the clerk. The remainder will be filed from the trust acct. to the Clerks office within the next week. Address confirmed. Bond continues.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 20, 2016 at 04:15 pm.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes. Investigator Rose. DF ATTY: Aaron A. Nelson DF: Ryan Lee Thompson appeared. Case called at 4:35.   Court advises of rights and possible penalties regarding a preliminary hearing. Court finds DF has freely, voluntarily, and knowingly waived the right to a preliminary hearing, finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial. An Information has been filed by the State.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Filed by Atty Nelson. Requesting a continuance of 6/11/2015 PH. Hearing reset. km
Preliminary hearing on July 28, 2015 at 04:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 11, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Harry W.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
